abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade and Transport Facilitation in
            South East Europe Project in Macedonia had a satisfactory
            outcome, is likely to be sustainable, and has a substantial
            development impact. The performances of the Borrower and the
            Bank are rated satisfactory. Project and program-related
            lessons pertained to interagency cooperation at border cross
            points, replication of procedures at pilot sites, customs
            control culture, support for the trade and transport
            facilitation in South East Europe website, procedures on
            border stations, multifunctional border inspection
            facilities, comprehensive solutions for border/clearance
            delays, high level government support, cumbersome visa
            procedures and requirements for professional drivers that
            slow down road freight transport, the bank's focus in
            the future programs, a holistic corridor approach at the
            regional level, policy dialogue, flexibility in project
            design,  synchronization of proposed activities at the
            regional level, the contribution of the United States as a
            parallel financier, avoiding overlaps with the European
            Union's integrated border management,  there must be a
            simple organizing principle to help
            implementation/supervision in multi-country operations, and
            using the same project team across countries in
            multi-country operations.
